title.narrative: Provision of an integrated and immediate lifesaving assistance to people displaced from Palma

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to provide life-saving health, nutrition, child protection assistance, and Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) to the persons affected by the attacks and clashes in Palma district, Cabo Delgado province. UNICEF and its Nutrition partners will support procurement and distribution up to the end-user of life-saving nutrition supplies; Mobile brigades with integrated maternal child health and nutrition services; and Community-based treatment of children with SAM at IDP sites and host communities. The health project will entail the procurement and distribution of interagency emergency health kit (IEHK) modules and mosquito nets to ensure primary health care services continue for the IDPs and host communities. UNICEF and its WASH partners will provide critical life-saving water, sanitation, and hygiene services, non-food items, and WASH infrastructure for vulnerable populations, including IDPs, host communities, and populations at high risk for disease transmission. The nutrition project will target 39,296 children, health will reach a total of 58,000 people, including 15,000 women, 14,000 men, 29,000 children, the child protection will target a total of 4,380, including 2230 women, men 150, 4,000 children, and WASH program will reach 22,675 persons includes 7256 women, 5669 men and9750 children. This program will reach a total of 8,088 persons with Disabilities.
